title: Manhattan Project National Historical Park: Foundation Document
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Planning     Foundation Document              Foundation Document       The National Park Service (NPS) has committed to developing a Foundation Document for each unit of the National Park System. The purpose of a Foundation Document is to affirm a national park unit's core mission and significance, its key resources and values, and the interpretive themes conveying its important stories. Although not a decision-making instrument, including neither actions nor management strategies, the Foundation Document, nevertheless, describes a shared understanding of what is most important about the park.    In February 2016, the NPS and Department of Energy held workshops in Oak Ridge, Hanford, and Los Alamos to begin developing the Foundation Document for Manhattan Project National Historical Park. Open houses were held in each of the three communities to gather input from the related to the important resources, stories and opportunities for the park. Read a summary of the comments. Work on the document is continuing and is expected to be complete in late 2016.   The Foundation Document will affirm the underlying guidance for future management and planning decisions at Manhattan Project National Historical Park.
